document_title: Finger arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Finger arthritis is a condition that can occur in any finger such as the thumb joint, the little finger joint... This disease is a condition in which the cartilage at the ends of the bones that form the finger joints wears out or degenerates. , which happened slowly over many years.
When inflammation leads to osteoarthritis of the hands and fingers, the cartilage covering the ends of the bones is reduced in quality. The cartilage surface becomes rough. The bones then rub against each other, which can lead to joint damage. Joint damage can lead to the growth of new bones along the sides of existing bones (bone spurs) or create bumps on the patient's finger joints. (first)
See more: What is arthritis?
